text: Andrea Francolisio d'Aquino (1639–1715) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Tricarico (1673–1676). ==Biography== Andrea Francolisio d'Aquino was born on 29 Jul 1639 in Naples and ordained a priest on 30 Nov 1672. On 27 Feb 1673, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Clement X as Bishop of Tricarico. On 12 Mar 1673, he was consecrated bishop by Gasparo Carpegna, Cardinal-Priest of San Silvestro in Capite, with Alessandro Crescenzi, Titular Patriarch of Alexandria, and Giacinto Libelli, Archbishop of Avignon, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Tricarico until his resignation on 18 Jun 1676. He died on 23 Mar 1715. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Clement X Category:1639 births Category:1715 deaths Category:17th-century Neapolitan people Category:18th- century Neapolitan people
title: Andrea Francolisio d'Aquino
